bib.title: Consumer wearables and affective computing for wellbeing support
bib.author: Saganowski, Stanis{\l}aw and Kazienko, Przemys{\l}aw and Dzie{\.z}yc, Maciej and Jakim{\'o}w, Patrycja and Komoszy{\'n}ska, Joanna and Michalska, Weronika and Dutkowiak, Anna and Polak, Adam and Dziadek, Adam and Ujma, Micha{\l}
bib.abstract: Wearables equipped with pervasive sensors enable us to monitor physiological and behavioral signals in our everyday life. We propose the WellAff system able to recognize affective states for wellbeing support. It also includes health care scenarios, in particular patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) suffering from bipolar disorders. For the need of a large-scale field study, we revised over 50 off-the-shelf devices in terms of usefulness for emotion, stress, meditation, sleep, and physical activity recognition and analysis.
